Class ec.ezlib.prim.Queue 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.ezlib.prim.Queue
public class Queue
extends Object
Unlike earlier, Queue is now a thread-safe data structure, providing its own lock. Currently, Queue does not provide a method to block waiting on an empty queue, since Runner is currently its only client, and Runner needs to do its own waiting. Should Queue be reused elsewhere, this method should probably be provided.

See Also:
Runner;

Queue()
Makes a Queue that can hold any object.
Queue(Class)
Makes a Queue that can hold objects of the specified elementType.

enqueue(Object)
Add a new element to the queue.
optDequeue()
Get the least-recently-added element off of the queue, or null if the queue is empty.

Queue 
 public Queue()
Makes a Queue that can hold any object.

Queue 
 public Queue(Class elementType)
Makes a Queue that can hold objects of the specified elementType. 'elementType' may not be a primitive (ie, scalar) type.

optDequeue 
 public Object optDequeue()
Get the least-recently-added element off of the queue, or null if the queue is empty. Currently, there's no way for the reader to distinguish reading from an empty queue from reading an enqueued null.

enqueue 
 public void enqueue(Object newElement)
Add a new element to the queue.
